text: Is it possible to prevent cloning of certain dnd_areas in the editor? i just had an editor clone the header multiple times in several landing pages and when i wanted to apply a gradient to the header area, the gradient covered 90% of the page, because the editor copied the header module and changed the content :eyes:
is it possible to password protect a HubDB Page?
a dynamic HubDB page i mean

In regards to the webhook API, I know order of the events is not guaranteed so I should look at the occurredAt field and order it myself but I noticed that I received an object creation event after an event for a property change on the same object. Even with the timestamp in occurredAt, the creation came 0.092 seconds after the propertyChange. I know it doesn’t seem like much but if I order the events myself by occurredAt, the order would still be reversed.

If you have CMS membership yes, you could do it based on the "logged in" hubl tag.

If you want all dynamic pages password protected (same password) you just need to set the password on the root page
As far as I know, blog topic cannot be displayed on the results page. Unless they added this feature to the Search function recently.
Yes, you can set the Featured Image as a background image on the Search Results page. Just clone the default “Site Search Results” module and change the markup as you see fit.
Hi all, is there a way to integrate registrations with Linkedin in HubSpot?
Yeah, I can attest to that :point_up::skin-tone-2: . The only problem is if the default hs module gets updated, you’ll have to manually update yours to match (if you want the updated functionality)
Hey Everyone, does any of you have any cool solution to pre-fill address info w geolocation data in a standard HubSpot form that is going to be used in a third party website?
